ResourceHeader.ResourceName: OMNI, Combined Solar Wind Plasma Moments and Interplanetary Magnetic Field (IMF) Time-Shifted to the Nose of the Earth's Bow Shock, plus Geomagnetic Indices, 1 min Data

RevisionEvent.Note: Updated to SPASE Version 2.3.2 if needed, Applied quality control for DOI usage, LFB

Updated PublishedBy name to match ROR Registry. Added ResourceType and NamingAuthority. Changed http to https in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Fixed version number separator in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Matched version number in schemaLocation attribute to updated value in Version tag. ZCB
Added MetadataRightsList and RightsList(s). Updated to 2.7.1. ZCB

ResourceHeader.Description:
Near-Earth Heliospheric Data, OMNI, Definitive Multispacecraft Interplanetary Parameters Data, 1 min averaged
Additional information for all parameters are available from OMNI Data Documentation: https://omniweb..sci.gsfc.nasa.gov/html/HROdocum.html
New data may be accesible via the Space Physics Data Facility, SPDF, OMNIWeb Service: https://omniweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/ow_min.html
The Modified (Level-3) High Resolution OMNI data files are made in the same format as the OMNI files based on SWE Key Parameter data. There are a few differences between old and new high resolution OMNI data sets:
* 1) In the newly modified Level-3 OMNI data files, we used the Wind SWE plasma definitive data rather than the Wind SWE plasma KP-despiked data. Using the definitive data give us possibility to include the Alpha/Proton Density Ratio and to use more accurate plasma parameters. However, the time coverage in the new OMNI data was decreased by from 2% to 10%. See the data description at https://spdf.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/data/omni/high_res_omni/modified/. For detail comparison 1 min SWE definitive and cross-normalized SWE Key Parameter data sets, see https://omniweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/ftpbrowser/wind_pla_def_kp_norm.html. * 2) To keep the number of words and the record lengths the same as in the old OMNI high resolution data set, we replaced the PCN Index (word #45) in the ASCII records with the new Alpha/Proton Density Ratio parameter. * 3) The latest date for these new data is usually behind of the OMNI based on SWE_KP data.
Modifications:
* 1) Conversion to ISTP/IACG CDFs via SKTEditor, February 2000 * 2) Time tags in CDAWeb version were modified to use the CDAWeb convention of having mid-average time tags rather than OMNI original convention of start-of-average time tags, March 2005
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Please acknowledge the Principal Investigator J.H. King and N.E. Papitashvili for use of the Data

PublicationInfo.Authors: Papitashvili, Natalia E.; & King, Joseph H.

InformationURL.Name: OMNI Data Documentation, 1 min and 5 min Observations
InformationURL.Description: OMNI Data Documnetation for 1 min and 5 min solar wind data sets at the Earth's bow shock nose

InformationURL.Name: Goddard Space Flight Center, GSFC, Space Physics Data Facility, SPDF, OMNIWeb Service
InformationURL.Description: Goddard Space Flight Center, GSFC, Space Physics Data Facility, SPDF, OMNIWeb Service. Additional data access options for high resolution (1 min and 5 min) OMNI solar wind magnetic field and plasma data at Earth's bow shock nose, geomagnetic activity indices, and energetic proton fluxes (5 min data only).

InformationURL.Description: Release Notes: News for High Resolution OMNI data

Parameter.Name: Epoch Time
Parameter.Description: Epoch Time Tags

Parameter.Name: Four Digit Year
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Four Digit Year

Parameter.Name: Decimal Day of Year
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Decimal Day of Year, January 1 is Day 1

Parameter.Name: Decimal Hour of Day
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Decimal Hour of Day

Parameter.Name: Decimal Minute of Hour
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Decimal Minute of Hour

Parameter.Name: Omni Spacecraft ID, interplanetary magnetic field values
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: OMNI Spacecraft ID, code for the source of the data used to calculate the time-shifted interplanetary magnetic field, IMF, values, see the OMNI documentation link for a list of the Spacecraft ID codes
Parameter.Caveats: The following spacecraft IDs are used: ACE 71, Geotail 60, IM 50, Wind 51

Parameter.Name: Omni Spacecraft ID, interplanetary plasma values
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: OMNI Spacecraft ID, code for the source of the data used to calculate the time-shifted interplanetary plasma, IP, values, see the OMNI documentation link for a list of the Spacecraft ID codes
Parameter.Caveats: The following spacecraft IDs are used: ACE 71, Geotail 60, IM 50, Wind 51

Parameter.Name: Interplanetary Magnetic Field, number of fine time scale observations per average value
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Number of fine time scale observations per Interplanetary Magnetic Field, IMF, Average

Parameter.Name: Interplanetary Plasma, number of fine scale observations per average value
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Number of fine time scale observations per Interplanetary Plasma, IP, Average

Parameter.Name: Percent of interpolated Solar Wind Observations
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Percent of interpolated Solar Wind Observations. The percentage of the points contributing to the 1 min magnetic field averages whose phase front normal, PFN, was interpolated because neither the MVAB-0 nor Cross Product shift techniques yielded a PFN that satisfied its respective tests.
Parameter.Caveats: The percentage of the points contributing to th min magnetic field averages whose phase front normal, PFN, was interpolated because neither the MVAB-0 nor Cross Product shift techniques yielde PFN that satisfied its respective tests.

Parameter.Name: Solar Wind Propagation Time Shift
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Solar Wind Propagation Time Shift

Parameter.Name: Solar Wind Propagation Time Shift, RMS
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Solar Wind Propagation Time Shift, Root Mean Square, RMS

Parameter.Name: Solar Wind Phase Front Normal, RMS
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Solar Wind Phase Front Unit Vector Normal Direction, Root Mean Square, RMS. Note that standard deviations for the two vectors are given as the square roots of the sum of squares of the standard deviations in the component averages. The component averages are given in the records but not their individual standard deviations.

Parameter.Name: Time between Observations
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Time between Observations

Parameter.Name: Interplanetary Magnetic Field Vector, Average Magnitude
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Interplanetary Magnetic Field, B, Vector, Average Magnitude

Parameter.Name: Interplanetary Magnetic Field, Bx-component, GSE Coordinates
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Interplanetary Magnetic Field, Bx-component, Geocentric Solar Ecliptic, GSE, Cartesian Coordinates

Parameter.Name: Interplanetary Magnetic Field, By-component, GSE Coordinates
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Interplanetary Magnetic Field, By-component, Geocentric Solar Ecliptic, GSE, Cartesian Coordinates

Parameter.Name: Interplanetary Magnetic Field, Bz-component, GSE Coordinates
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Interplanetary Magnetic Field, Bz-component, Geocentric Solar Ecliptic, GSE, Cartesian Coordinates

Parameter.Name: Interplanetary Magnetic Field, By-component, GSM Coordinates
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Interplanetary Magnetic Field, By-component, Geocentric Solar Magnetospheric, GSM, Cartesian Coordinates, determined from post-shift values components

Parameter.Name: Interplanetary Magnetic Field, Bz-component, GSM Coordinates
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Interplanetary Magnetic Field, Bz-component, Geocentric Solar Magnetospheric, GSM, Cartesian Coordinates, determined from post-shift values components

Parameter.Name: Interplanetary Magnetic Field Vector Magnitude, RMS Standard Deviation
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Interplanetary Magnetic Field Vector Magnitude, B, Root Mean Square, RMS, Standard Deviation

Parameter.Name: Interplanetary Magnetic Field Vector, RMS Standard Deviation
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Interplanetary Magnetic Field Vector, B, Root Mean Square, RMS, Standard Deviation
Parameter.Caveats: Note that standard deviations for the two vectors are given as the square roots of the sum of squares of the standard deviations in the component averages. The component averages are given in the records but not their individual standard deviations.

Parameter.Name: Solar Wind Flow Speed
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Solar Wind Flow Speed, V

Parameter.Name: Solar Wind Velocity, Vx-component, GSE Coordinates
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Solar Wind Velocity, Vx-component, Geocentric Solar Ecliptic, GSE, Cartesian Coordinates

Parameter.Name: Solar Wind Velocity, Vy-component, GSE Coordinates
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Solar Wind Velocity, Vy-component, Geocentric Solar Ecliptic, GSE, Cartesian Coordinates

Parameter.Name: Solar Wind Velocity, Vz-component, GSE Coordinates
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Solar Wind Velocity, Vz-component, Geocentric Solar Ecliptic, GSE, Cartesian Coordinates

Parameter.Name: Solar Wind Proton Number Density
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Solar Wind Proton Number Density, Np

Parameter.Name: Solar Wind Plasma Temperature
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Solar Wind Plasma Temperature, T

Parameter.Name: Solar Wind Alpha Particle to Proton Number Density Ratio
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Solar Wind Alpha Particle to Proton Number Density Ratio, Na/Np
Parameter.Caveats: The new parameter Na/Np Ratio is included using Wind SWE definitive data.

Parameter.Name: Solar Wind Flow Dynamic Pressure
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Solar Wind Flow Dynamic Pressure, p
Parameter.Caveats: Derived parameters are obtained from the following equations. Flow pressur (2*10**-6)*Np*Vp**2 nPa (Np in cm**-3, Vp in km/s, subscrip for proton)

Parameter.Name: Solar Wind Motional Electric Field
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Solar Wind Motional Electric Field, E, equal to -(Vx (in km/s) Bz (in nT))/1000
Parameter.Caveats: Derived parameters are obtained from the following equations. Electric fiel -V(km/s Bz (nT; GSM 10**-3

Parameter.Name: Solar Wind Plasma Beta
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Solar Plasma Beta, β, Ratio of the plasma pressure over the magnetic field pressure
Parameter.Caveats: Derived parameters are obtained from the following equations. Plasma bet [(T*4.16/10**5 5.34 N B**2 (B in nT)

Parameter.Name: Solar Wind Alfvén Mach Number
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Solar Wind Alfvén Mach Number, Ma, Ratio of the Flow Speed over the Alfvén Speed
Parameter.Caveats: Derived parameters are obtained from the following equations. Alfven Mach numbe ( Np**0.5 2 B

Parameter.Name: Solar Wind Magnetosonic Mach Number
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Solar Wind Magnetosonic Mach Number, Ms, Ratio of the Flow Speed over the square root of the sum of the Gas Dynamic Sound Speed squared and the Alfvén Speed squared
Parameter.Caveats: Derived parameters are obtained from the following equations. Magnetosonic Mach numbe V/Magnetosonic_speedMagnetosonic spee [(sound speed)** (Alfv speed)**2]**0.5The Alfven spee 20 N**0.5The sound spee 0.1 [ 1.28*10**5]**0.5

Parameter.Description: Spacecraft Position, x-component, Geocentric Solar Ecliptic, GSE, Cartesian Coordinates

Parameter.Name: AE Index
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: AE Index, from the World Data Center, WDC, Kyoto, the index values are final for the time interval from 1988-01-01 to 1988-06-30 are provisional for the time interval from 1990-01-01 to 2018-02-28

Parameter.Name: AL Index
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: AL Index, from the World Data Center, WDC, Kyoto, the index values are final for the time interval from 1988-01-01 to 1988-06-30 are provisional for the time interval from 1990-01-01 to 2018-02-28

Parameter.Name: AU Index
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: AU Index, from the World Data Center, WDC, Kyoto, the index values are final for the time interval from 1988-01-01 to 1988-06-30 are provisional for the time interval from 1990-01-01 to 2018-02-28

Parameter.Name: SYM D Index
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: SYM D Index, from World Data Center, WDC, Kyoto for the time interval from 1981-01-01

Parameter.Name: SYM H Index
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: SYM H Index, from World Data Center, WDC, Kyoto for the time interval from 1981-01-01

Parameter.Name: ASY D Index

Parameter.Name: ASY H Index
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: ASY H Index, from World Data Center, WDC, Kyoto for the time interval from 1981-01-01
